title: Latest Conda requires "conda activate" instead of "source activate", breaking mlflow run
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Mac OS 10.14.5
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.0.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.1
- **npm version (if running the dev UI): 6.7.0
- **Exact command to reproduce**: mlflow run examples/sklearn_elasticnet_wine -P alpha=0.42

### Describe the problem
Install conda from https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/Anaconda2-2019.03-MacOSX-x86_64.sh. Run the script, and allow Conda to manage conda init when asked. This will place the following code in your bash_profile or zshrc:

# >>> conda initialize >>>

__conda_setup="$('/Users/ankit.mathur/anaconda2/bin/conda' 'shell.bash' 'hook' 2> /dev/null)"
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
    eval "$__conda_setup"
else
    if [ -f "/Users/ankit.mathur/anaconda2/etc/profile.d/conda.sh" ]; then
        . "/Users/ankit.mathur/anaconda2/etc/profile.d/conda.sh"
    else
        export PATH="/Users/ankit.mathur/anaconda2/bin:$PATH"
    fi
fi
unset __conda_setup

It seems that when this happens, it goes through the if block and not the else block, never adding bin to the path. This means that `conda activate` works but `source activate` does not. This means that running the tutorial at: https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tutorial.html breaks when you do `mlflow run` because that generates a new conda environment and tries to switch to it by doing source activate.
